channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How social media users are using AI vision boards and ‘life trailers’ to manifest their dream lives

item.title: As Trump cracks down on international students, college applications rise overseas
item.description: In China , wait times for U.S. visa interviews are so long that some students have given up. Universities in Hong Kong are fielding transfer inquiries...

item.title: 5 Expert tips to help you take control of your buy now, pay later loans
item.description: Between rising prices and dwindling job growth, using “buy now, pay later” on everything from concert tickets to fast food deliveries is becoming incr...

item.title: Workplace Diversity and Social Programs Thrive by Going Undercover
item.description: Political opposition to DEI and CSR has led many companies to stop communicating about their policies — but that doesn’t mean they aren’t using them.

item.title: Here’s the one-page memo Warren Buffett sent to his managers every two years for over 25 years
item.description: Forget profit, billionaire Warren Buffett wants Berkshire Hathaway staff to worry first about reputation.

item.title: How Patreon and Kajabi Have Helped Creators Earn a Combined $20 Billion
item.description: Both creator economy companies announced reaching the milestone this week.

item.title: The ultra-wealthy expect hotel-level amenities for their homes—and developers are racing to keep up
item.description: A simple pool and gym aren’t enough to attract wealthy residents anymore.

item.title: Claire’s stores closing: See the list of doomed locations as tween retailer files for second bankruptcy

item.title: Figma’s IPO Was a Hit. Here Are 8 More to Watch in 2025
item.description: The IPO market appears to be thawing. These are some of the companies that could go public this year.

item.title: A bright spot for Tesla shareholders: Under Elon Musk’s new $27 comp package, their fate is now intertwined with his
item.description: If shareholders suffer over the next five years, so will Musk.

item.title: Female founders from brands like Outdoor Voices and the Wing are ready for a comeback. We should be too
item.description: Audrey Gelman and Ty Haney are building again, five years after losing control of their companies. It's about time.

item.title: Stop Grinding. Start Building Workplace Joy
item.description: From employee clubs to passion-driven assignments, here’s how to make work engaging.

item.title: Fearing tariff-induced price hikes, parents are back-to-school shopping earlier than any year on record
item.description: More than two-thirds of families started buying pencils, pens, paper and folders in early July.

item.title: This Taylor Swift-Approved Brand’s Viral Moment Led to a Projected $40 Million in Sales
item.description: Beauty startup Fazit was well-prepared to capitalize on the pop star’s promotion of its product.
